alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 12:12AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Heavy Wet Snow With Strong Winds Reducing Visibilities... A band of heavy wet snow will continue to move eastward across the area through 2 AM. Northwest winds between 25 and 30 mph will continue, with gusts up to 45 mph at times. These winds combined with the snow will make for greatly reduced visibility down to under a mile at times. The strong winds will also produce difficult travel for high profile vehicles, especially on north to south roadways. The heavy snow will produce quick accumulations up to an inch especially on grassy and elevated surfaces. Some slick spots could also develop on bridges and overpasses, as temperatures drop below the freezing mark. Be alert for these changing conditions, sudden reductions in visibility, and slick spots if traveling overnight.
